Hi... My name is Mary O'Reilly O'Toole O'Shea and...over island my friend Muffy owns... It's spring break... and s us over for the weekend, and we're waiting for the ferry us there... (blushing, mortified to cameraman) I don't know what else to say!

Something about myself? Oh, Gee... (composing herself, earnestly) Well, I want to work with handicapped children... My pare best Friends... Next semester I start convent school, and the first date. Pass.

C'mon , Arch? Skip? He PANS over to the other two college boys on the dock he big, good-natured, easygoing WASP jock (rugby and crew); Preppy, the perfect image of the lazy spoiled, indulged, upper-crust kid. Skip also happens to be Muffy's cousin.
(ponders it with due consideration) Yeah, sure... I fuck on the first date... Skip cracks up. Arch's laughter follows.
Where's Rob? Chaz QUICK-PANS the camera back to Kit, following the act

Oh, Kit... Concerned, Kit keeps her humor anyway, waving the lens aw

(looks at her, persisting) Well?

The driver -- a still great-looking, turned-out Fairfield SUBURBAN LADY -- and the passenger, ROB FERRIS a cleancut goodlooking, 20 year old public school grad sit in uncomf silence on opposite ends of the front seat.
(gestures, awkwardly) Here'll be fine, thanks...
The Volvo wagon pulls over. Rob drags out his daypack, to
Thanks... for the lift, I mean...

(smiles, no reason for disappointment) It was a real lift for me, too, hon. A late model Detroit sedan slows at the intersection, tur highway to take the junction in the direction Rob is goin sign indicates: "BAR HARBOR MOUNT DESERT" in another dire Rob hefts his gear, hurrying to flag the sedan. The Volvo wagon continues on, braking for the next underg male hitchhiking down the road.

CLOSE ON a wall calendar. A HAND reaches INTO FRAME, tear "MARCH" to begin "APRIL". WIDEN TO REVEAL CLARA, the middle-aged housekeeper and of caretaker for the house. With her overcoat and purse on o drops the "MARCH" calendar page in a wastebasket, then cr pantry where a door and wooden steps lead down to the bas
The rooms are all in order, double- and triple-checked, a way... She hears a CLATTER from down below.
MUFFY ST. JOHN drags a woman's body across the floor. The off in her hand.
Shit.

Old workclothes and a head kerchief ta of Muffy's normally impeccable prep Seven Sisters outfit the regulation penny loafers) in all this dust. Sure you don't want me to stay? There's nobody gonna be a here to help till first ferry back Monday, y'know...

(a buoyant laugh) Nice? It has to be better than nice... it's gotta be bloo unforgettable! Clara climbs the stairs.
Good luck.

Bye, Clara. See you Monday. Soon there's the upstairs SOUND of the kitchen door closi Clara. Muffy finally props the mannequin, clearing away the rema clutter. She goes to open a basement window for ventilati ground-level transom, hinged at the top. Through it Clara departing the grounds. Then Muffy hears a DRIPPING. She turns, hesitating, and f sounds.

Part of the basement, an old washroom and more, with tub, and large incinerator. Muffy enters, pulling the chain on overhead bulb. It illuminates the room, and the tub under slightly rusty at the drain, but otherwise spotless -- an dripping faucet.
CHAZ, the videocameraman and the only member of the group seen till now, is the first to spot the ferry approaching

Here she comes... He's a real hi-tech freak and Ivy League wiseass, a free neo-punk neck curl and button-down shirt. He shoulders hi videopak again, taping it. Arch and Skip watch with him f of the pier. But Kit and Nikki, waiting nearer the office distracted by the SOUND of an arriving car.

It's not Rob, though. It's NAN, another newcomer. She pul next to the others in the gravel lot behind the landing o gets out quickly, dragging a hefty suitcase out of the ba is an unfamiliar face to Kit and Nikki --a shy, earnest, girl, overdressed for the occasion.
Hi... is this the ferry to the St. John house?
Any second now.
Oh, thank goodness ! I didn't know if I was on the right Kit smiles welcome, lending a hand as Nan struggles the b ramp.
Hi. Kit Graham... Nikki Brashears.
Nan Youngblood.
(needling, about the suitcase) Planning on staying a while?
(flushes, embarrassed) Oh, no... just some work for finals, when we get back... know how far behind I am... Arch outhustles Chaz for her bag. Her simple attractivene appeal.
Hi. Arch Cummings . I've seen you around. Jewett Hall, ri
Chaz Vyshinsky. You got great legs.
(pointed1y, reminds him) Chaz, Arch already has her bag. Meaning, Chaz is Nikki's man, especially for this weekend
(volunteering, happily) Well, I only met Muffy this term in Drama Society . I vol do their costumes... I like to sew... Did you see her in so talented. She was wonderful!
(to Nan, approvingly; in greeting) Congratulations, on finding your way. The landing BUMPS, the ferry touches down. They look up.

Stand clear! The large, raw-boned FERRYMAN holds open the wooden stile and only passenger from the island  Clara -- to disembark passes them , giving first Skip and then the others a loo her head in sad appraisal. FERRYMAN (cont.)

Ok, let's go. It's not the friendliest greeting in the world. The ferry stile open for them to board singly. There is also a youn on board -- BUCK, a pleasant, openfaced townie in his 20s FERRYMAN (cont.) To the rear. Outa the operator's way. Nikki clutches at Skip's arm.
This is it? No going back? Trapped for days on an island men are men, and women oughta know better?
Try to control yourself, Sister O'Toole.
You could tie me in chains... Chaz boards, passing Buck, the assistant.

(a low whisper) Your fly's open, and your Hostess Twinkie's hanging out.. The assistant gapes, falling for it, groping his fly. Whi of course. He looks up, grinning. Chaz kisses him on the and moves on.
Sh -i-i-t... Kit is hanging back on the dock.
Come on if you're coming.
Excuse me. But we're still waiting for somebody --
It's Friday. My last run of the week. I don't get paid ov
But you've got to wait. They said it's the only way over. If he misses this... Arch WHISTLES loudly, seeing and alerting them.

A late model Detroit sedan (the one we saw earlier turnin highway) pulls to a fast stop in the lot. Rob hurries out comes up from the group on the ferry. Kit closes her eyes Rob comes hurrying up the ramp.
...followed closely by HARVEY 'HAL' EDISON, JR.

Wait up! Harvey is the driver of the sedan, and after he carefully comes running with his bag, too. He is a rangy, straight- League farmboy from the Border South, and he's the last o invited guests. He also, somewhat incongruously, sports a Springsteen badge.
(to Kit, kissing her) Sorry... Nik, Chaz... (to Skip and Nan whom he doesn't know) Rob Ferris... They return greetings.
Hi! Harvey 'Hal' Edison, Jr., but please call me Hal. Onl call me Harve... and I can't stand it. Boy, this sure is spot. Stylistically, he's a Martian. Chaz stares at him.
You're friends with... Muffy St. John?
Sure am. We sit together in Econ 345. I let her copy my m utility curves.
I get it. That's a joke. Preppy Skip adds his greeting.
(an ironical nod) Harve.
(correcting him, blithely) Hal... (noticing interest his badge) Springsteen, he's still the Boss!
Ok, c'mon, I don't have all day. He slams the stile down after Harvey, the last to board, with the stubborn motor. His assistant helps. Chaz tapes.
(enthusiastically, putting down his fear) YOU all buddies?
Except for Skip and Nan. Them we just met.
But we will be.
Watch what you say around him, though. He's Muffy's cousi
(tickled, to Skip) No kiddin'?
Distant. Over the horizon. Otherwise, I wouldn't be invited... (frowns, tellingly) Old money never mixes family with friends.
This is true. For as long as I've known her.
To protect her family, I guess.
To keep her friends. He turns to Arch, holds up his hand, and CLICK, a switchb into the lens. SKIP (cont.) Choose your weapons, big guy.
(nervously, a laugh) Hey, what's this...?
You up for a game of stretch?
(still taping, to Skip) Your fly's open.
Eat it.
(undaunted, to Rob) Your fly's open.
Ok, so don't believe me. He keeps the tape rolling. Rob discreetly looks down. His open. Kit looks at him dubiously. Rob zips. Chaz beams, g for posterity. The engine finally engages. The ferry lurc
(smiles weakly to Kit) We're off! They are indeed.
The ferry pulls away from the mainland.
A CLOSER ANGLE. The sturdy, barge like ship craft makes p Ferryman and Buck remain at the stern.
As Skip's knife flies INTO FRAME, it bites into the board
at their game. Arch stretches, can't reach the knife, and over. Skip hoots triumphantly.
First round, the champ!
Nikki, much to her chagrin, finds herself the object of H attentions.
Y'know what I find amazin'? Muffy's her real name. I mean I'm Harvey, but they call me Hal, so I thought, 'Muffy', stand for something... Muffin?
Muffers, Moffo, Muff-child , Muffin' stuff, the Muffster.
I bet you're her oldest friend.
Actually, she's three months older than I am.
You know what I mean.
Harvey... are you planning a career in politics when you
I've given it some thought. Why?
Oh, just a hunch.
First, though, I'm hopin' to interview with her daddy's company, Southern Regional Sales, next year before gradua Y'know, he's worth more'n 50 mill over the counter! She just stares at him.
digging into the deck again.
Jesus... ARCH and SKIP The knife is at an impossible distance.
Go for it, big fella. Arch swallows his pride and makes a hopeless attempt.
fastens onto Nan, immersed in one of her books. He carrie
(sitting beside her) Whatcha readin'?
Milton. Paradise Lost. For Professor Russo's course on th English epic... It's a shame. It's a dying form. Not too read it nowadays, even in college. What's yours?
Suck and fuck. Naked bodies writhing in heat. Women with their tongues s in desparate desire... Nan tries to control her reaction of graphic pornographic video catalogues and magazines.

The origins of American pornographic film. I'm taking an independent study this term. (the passion and commitment show) My advisor's really behind me on it. We're not gonna be s college kids all our lives. Someday I'm gonna have kids - you're gonna have kids  and someday that kid's gonna come to me and say, 'God, Dad, porn's really a major part of o lives. You were there, how'd it get started?' I wanna be able to answer their questions.
Besides, it's research I can do by myself.
They keep their voices low.
That's not my point --
You don't want me to hitch, you want me to buy a car. OK, I'm a state university boy, I don't have the perks like s of you private college kids do.
Oh, c'mon, don't pull that. Rob just drops his arms in frustration. KIT (cont.) I mean, it may show something about your attitude toward always being late.
Kit... Arch's voice interrupts.
(annoyed, loudly, overriding the other conversations) Hey, I'm really not interested anymore --
C'mon, just one more The others look up at the interruption.
Arch pushes the knife back into Skip's hand, tired of pla toss.
I said, enough's enough--
One more try, double or nothing. He flips the knife to Arch, handle first.
C'mon, give it a fuckin' rest! He flips it back hard. Something happens. Skip looks up s Arch's voice catches in his throat in horror.
Skip stares back, disbelieving, looking down and pulling from his chest, where the blood begins to seep and the ja sticks out, buried hilt-deep between his ribs.
Oh, fuck.

Nan screams. Skip stumbles, teetering there at the edge o Rob and Chaz leap to their feet. The ferrymen both look u disbelief. Arch steps forward to help. But Skip, weaving, splashes overboard. He goes under.

(panicked, hurrying to the side) I'll get him, I'll get him! But he stops just at the edge of the ferry, immobilized b Rob rushes forward, with Chaz in reserve, pulling Arch ou way. But Buck, the assistant ferryman, pre-empts them all Arch, frozen, watches from the deck with the others. Buck resurfaces, but without any sign of Skip. Rob doesn' longer. He pulls off his shoes and dives in. Chaz gets re suit. The panic mounts. Suddenly:
Hi, this what you're looking for?

Skip pulls himself up, dripping, on the other side of the holds up the knife -- and the padded sash beneath his shi imbed the knife -- and grins from ear to ear. The others totally freaked. Arch lets go, jumping in the air. Rob and Buck surface, t well.
We got 'em! Whoo-ee, did we nail 'em!

(as it dawns, to Skip) April Fools... you crazy jerks. You crazy motherfuckin' j somebody could've gotten hurt out there! Relief descends. Rob isn't laughing. But nobody's more im assistant Buck, still treading water.
You maniacs... you almost gave us a heart attack! Kit glowers at them and gives Rob a hand to get out.
Well, at least we don't go in for this your-shoelaceis-un

(smiles, to Buck in the water) How's it goin' out there?
That was great!
I was really counting on these other turkeys to save my ass.
Oh, too bad. Skip extends a hand to Buck to help him out.
Sorry about that. But Buck's in no hurry. The ferryman steps forward.
(unamused, to Buck) Ok, c'mon, get out. They are approaching the landing dock on the island.
(to Buck, gruffly) C'mon I'm gonna need some help here. Buck obeys, but his way, enjoying it, ducking under the c to the other side to help.

And watch out for the wire! Too late. There's a sickening THUMP I The young assistant breaks the surface qf the water, panicked and stunned, ga air. It happens too fast for any of them to do anything. Buck dazed, off-balance, falling back into the path of the fer glides toward the landing.
Buck, look out--
Oh, shit... The ferryman grabs the controls, but it can't help. The ferry, unstoppable, plows into Buck, pinning him agai the piers. Buck screams.

Buck! The ferryman rushes forward to help. For a moment the others are spared the horror of it as th Ferryman's back blocks their view. But then Buck, thrashing in the water, tears himself, loo and bobbing. up, his head and torso covered in blood, the face and his shoulder hideously deformed. It is awful. It is ghastly. And it is unforgettable.
Oh, god!
SAM POTTER, the middle-aged township constable, hears the the screams. He drops what he's doing in his outboard and running.
The ferryman jumps into the shallow water, pulling Buck o Rob, Chaz and Arch jump after to help, but the ferryman p angrily away.
Get away from him! Buck is hysterical. The gashes of torn flesh seem to drip skull. Seeing Rob and the others, he screams, lunging vai in agony.
They did it... them!

Easy Buck... it's OK... OK... There's time for Later... easy... But it's hard for him to restrain his own rage. Constable Potter arrives, throwing the ferryman a towel t ferryman catches it, pressing it against Buck's torn face maddened, glaring eye still stares out hideously at the g

Get him to the hospital, Cal! Take my boat! He helps the ferryman lift Buck. But the powerful ferryma further help, carrying Buck to the Constable's motorboat nearby, laying Buck in, untying the line and pulling the life. Buck continues to shriek, terrifyingly. The ferryman cast one last glance back.
The SOUND of the motorboat fades away. Potter turns back stunned group, eyeing them.
All right... Let's have it.
Muffy drives up. She slows, seeing, through the windshiel scene at the pier... her friends in troubled conversation Constable Potter.

What's going on? Sam... what's wrong?
Tricks. Pranks. Better ask your friends... Buck's been hu took him on over to the mainland. Just lucky I was here.. She returns his stare in dread silence. He boards the fer
I came over to check on a report of some unauthorized activity in the area... Your dad around? She startles, the question 50 unanticipated.

No word from him, or anybody else?
No... He tries the engine. Nothing.
Just like I thought. . Burned out. Worthless... He steps back onto the shore.
I'll have to borrow your outboard to get back to shore.
We keep all the keys on the board in the kitchen, but I think there's an extra one underneath the cushion there. She points to the boat seat. Potter is much obliged.

(to the others, sternly) I'm glad you're stuck here, all o' you. If there's anvthi anything happens to Buck... I want to know where to find The van moves slowly along a narrow road through the fore we can see of its occupants, the mood is pretty grim. Beh old island pick-up truck follows.
Rob drives with Kit and Skip beside him in the cab. Nobod anything . Skip is off somewhere in his own private hell. reaches over to roll down his window, but the handle rota in his grip.
These goddamn windows! He starts banging violently on the door, on the window.
They've never been fixed...
Look, Skip, it wasn't your fault. It was an accident. You

What a way to start a weekend, huh.

Muffy. Nothing bad ever happens to her. EXT. ST. JOHN HOUSE. DAY. It is a truly grand affair, two stories at least, ramblin picture-perfect with extensive tended grounds, garage, an outbuildings. Oh; Muffy... Rob pulls the pick-up right behind them.
As they come in with their bags.

You sound as if you own it. She helps with bags, shepherding them on ahead.

Texas. You might be talking to your future boss, Harve.
Mom, I am home! They all look to see him standing in the entrance to the
as they follow Chaz into the room. A series of picture wi spectacular view of the sound.

It's like a dream.

The others enter to see what Chaz's shout is all about. (meaningfully, with her Barbie) I used to have all her outfits.

dropping onto a hot skillet .
Muffy, Nikki and Kit cooking a dinner of hot dogs... bake
...if only the choices weren't so limited. God, I'm so re change. Any kind of change.
Well, you know, everything they say about older men? It's Kit and Nikki stare at her, open-mouthed.

Like how much older are we talking about? Twenty-six?

It was only a weekend. It's over now. (beat, shrugs) I was curious.

How should I know? Kit and Nikki just drop everything and continue to stare
It was quite a weekend. Nikki starts to laugh.
Come to daddy. They all start to laugh now, wickedly, conspiratorially.
Come sit on daddy's knee, little girl... Nikki falls to the floor in hysterics.
My goodness, daddy, what big

He surveys the bo framed diplomas on the walls along with autographed photo presidents and other heads of state. He steps over to the desk, opens a cigar box sitting ther a cigar and slips it into his pocket.
Arch and Chaz are in the back lawn overlooking the sound. fooling around with Chaz's camera, maybe clowning a bit.
A'broad veranda which runs along the entire length of the house. Skip and Nan are sitting on the railing, gazing ov sounds. Skip has a drink.

(quietly, with deliberation) The poor boy can say, "Fuck you, Dad. I'm my own person." father going to do? Kick him out of the house? Disinherit life won't have changed that much. He's got nothing to lo PAUSE.
His father's love.
That's already been lost. Died a long, long time ago.
Skip, you're giving up. You're giving up before you've even gotten started.
Look at how young we all are. How young and foolish and i stupid... Skip raises his glass and gulps down the rest of his drin

Boy, Muff, you sure know how to make a guy look forward t

St. John hospitality taken to the extreme.
I think it's real friendly. Makes me feel right at home. Everyone starts to sit down at his designated place.
How friendly will we feel once we've finished with those

All conversation stops, each person looking for the guilt discreetly sits back down: but again, as soon as her tail chair, another blast escapes her... All eyes are on her as she reaches beneath her and pulls cushion.

as he grabs the salt-shaker and spills some of it out ont He samples a couple of grains. It's the real thing. He st his food.

Well, Harvey's got his job interview all figured out, but what about the rest of us? Anybody know what they're goin be doing come graduation? PAUSE. They sit dumbly. Another PAUSE.

Kit...

He said my grades might be OK; but that basically I posse essential lack of seriousness, and that's what they look

Skip.

Well... Someone once said to me to cherish the friends yo

Because... they'll be the friends you cherish most the re life. So, well, here's to us... here's to my life... beca glad to be here, and to be a part of all of you...
Muffy, anything you want to add to that?
Why me?
Because you're the hostess. Muffy thinks for a moment, then adds...

In his "Life of Johnson" James Boswell said, "We cannot t precise moment when friendship is formed. As in filling a by drop, there is at last a drop which makes it run over; series of kindnesses, there is at last one which makes th over." Arch has started to make snoring sounds. MUFFY (cont.) So with this toast may our hearts run over and our friend formed. They stand unanimously, raise their glasses in agreement, drink and spill it all down the front of their shirts. Dribble glasses. April Fool.

Goodnight.
Goodnight. Muffy leads Nikki to a narrow, sparse single, popping ope

You gotta be kiddin'...
(unloading his gear). Unless Muffy knows something about us we don't. He blows Arch a kiss, pulling the two beds apart again.
